healthy.description: This leaf appears to be healthy with no visible signs of disease. The leaf shows good color, structure, and vitality.

apple_scab.description: A fungal disease causing dark, velvety spots on leaves and fruit. Commonly affects apple trees and reduces yield.
recommendations: Remove infected leaves and fallen debris
Use appropriate fungicides during early season

bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial infection that causes water-soaked spots on leaves. Can lead to leaf drop and fruit blemishes.
recommendations: Improve air circulation around the plant

black_rot.description: Fungal disease in grapes causing blackened spots on leaves and rotting fruit. Spreads in humid conditions.
recommendations: Dispose fallen leaves and rotting fruit
Ensure proper drainage and air movement
Apply sulfur-based fungicides during growing season

cedar_apple_rust.description: Fungal disease with orange lesions on leaves. Alternates between apple and cedar trees during its life cycle.
recommendations: Remove galls from cedar trees nearby
Apply preventive fungicide early in the season
Avoid planting susceptible varieties close together

cercospora_leaf_spot.description: Fungal infection in crops like corn and soybeans. Reduces photosynthesis by forming gray/brown leaf spots.

common_rust.description: Rust-colored pustules appear on leaves, mainly affecting corn. Disease progresses in warm, humid weather.
recommendations: Apply foliar fungicides if infestation is heavy

early_blight.description: Dark brown leaf spots with concentric rings affecting potatoes and tomatoes. Weakens plants over time.
recommendations: Remove and destroy infected plant material

esca.description: Fungal disease in grapevines, causing leaf striping and poor fruit quality. May result in sudden vine death.

late_blight.description: Highly destructive disease in potatoes and tomatoes. Causes water-soaked lesions and plant collapse.

leaf_blight.description: General fungal condition that causes widespread browning and tissue death on leaves.

leaf_scorch.description: Non-infectious browning of leaf tips due to heat, drought or root damage. Common in summer.

northern_leaf_blight.description: Gray-green lesions on leaves of corn. Can cause significant yield loss if left untreated.

powdery_mildew.description: White powdery fungal growth on leaves, affecting many crops including grapes and cucurbits.
recommendations: Apply sulfur or neem oil sprays

septoria_leaf_spot.description: Fungal tomato disease with small, dark, circular lesions on leaves. Starts at lower leaves and spreads.

yellow_leaf_curl_virus.description: Viral infection in tomatoes and peppers spread by whiteflies. Causes curling, yellowing, and stunted growth.
